title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:05 <vmassol> wow 524MB in m2 repo to build commons, rendering, platform, enterprise…..  
00:06 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I'm ready to commit my changes for removing all maven remote repo defs from our pom.xml and instead use Nexus. Should I wait for you to finish the release before pushing? I can wait till tomorrow fi you're doing the release today  
00:06 <@sdumitriu> Push now  
00:07 <vmassol> ok  
00:07 <@sdumitriu> This way we can already push to central repo  
00:13 <vmassol> give me 5 minutes  
00:18 <vmassol> updating agent's .m2/settings.xml now  
00:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: all done. Waiting for CI to complete a full cycle. Just sent a mail too to explain the change for developers  
00:27 <@sdumitriu> K  
00:46 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Still up?  
00:46 <vmassol> yes  
00:47 <@sdumitriu> Build failed  
00:47 <vmassol> did you update your settings.xml?  
00:47 <sdumitriu> has quit  
00:48 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
00:48 <@sdumitriu> Sorry, damn'd pidgin died  
00:48 <@sdumitriu> Build failed  
00:48 <@sdumitriu> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/7539/console  
00:48 <@cjdelisle> 18:55 < vmassol> did you update your settings.xml?  
00:48 <@sdumitriu> But it looks like an infra problem  
00:49 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I updated the settings.xml on the agents but after some jobs were started  
00:49 <vmassol> the next builds should be ok (I hope)  
00:49 <@sdumitriu> OK  
00:49 <@sdumitriu> It was pretty recent so I assumed it was after the changes  
00:49 <vmassol> I should have updated the agents before pushing  
01:07 <@sdumitriu> Build passed now  
01:07 <vmassol> cool  
01:10 <vmassol> bed time, gl with the release

13:12 <vmassol> I've already added some comments but FTM I've fixed them locally  
13:12 <vmassol> I'll try to fix all my comments locally but if they're too large I'll ask you for new commits, ok?

13:33 <vmassol> sburjan: would be good to find out more about this:  
13:33 <vmassol>         // It seems that there are some issues refreshing content while this tab is not open. This might be a bug in the  
13:33 <vmassol>         // Annotations Application  
13:33 <vmassol>         annotatableViewPage.showAnnotationsPane();  
13:34 <vmassol> what happens when you do it manually?  
13:42 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't understand this:  
13:42 <vmassol>         // Landing directly on this page might result in notification not to be displayed  
13:42 <vmassol>         getDriver().navigate().refresh();  
13:58 <+sburjan> 1) is a little bit harder to explain. In all tset cases, after deleting an annotation, all the other little yellow marks disappear. this is why hovering on a annotation will bring the modal in the top left corner.  
13:58 <+sburjan> I was able to reproduce this manually in certain cases. it seems that the "Show annotations" from tab is not taken in consideration  
13:59 <vmassol> have you opened a jira issue?  
14:00 <+sburjan> no, because I don't know exactly if it is a bug or not  
14:00 <vmassol> the box in the corner is a bug for sure  
14:00 <vmassol> if you can reproduce it manually it can only be a bug  
14:00 <+sburjan> ok, I will try to reproduce manually, but it doesn't happend in all cases. I have to find a solid test case to be able to open a jira issue  
14:01 <+sburjan> it's most likely a js issue  
14:05 <+sburjan> and the 2), I think it's safe to remove that line, I put it long time ago to assure I will get the notification from the bottom  
14:05 <+sburjan> but we can discuss them in detail when you get back  
14:10 <vmassol> sburjan: let's see if the annotation test is fixed in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/68/ ;)  
14:10 <vmassol> got to go, bbiab  
14:10 <+sburjan> okay  
14:22 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <mbryant> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <mbryant> mflorea: I have a question about the office importing utility, mainly about the display macro and thought you might know something, or is there someone else that might be better to ask  
14:41 <+mflorea> Hi mbryant  
14:41 <+mflorea> what is the question?  
14:42 <mbryant> when you upload a ppt, it automaticallly puts them into a gallery type mode that allows you to flip through individual slides... is there a way, in 3.1 that would allow me to have all the images displayed at once, rather than a slideshow  
14:44 <+mflorea> there are two different, but related, features regarding ppt files: preview and import.  
14:45 <+mflorea> preview = if you have the oo server connected then you should see an eye icon near each ppt attachment  
14:46 <+mflorea> technically, the preview is done by importing the ppt in a temporary directory on the server and using the gallery macro to display the slides  
14:47 <+mflorea> import = oo server is used to extract slide images from the ppt file, which then are attached to the target wiki page. Again, attached images are displayed using the gallery macro  
14:47 <+mflorea> mbryant: which of these two features would you like to customize?  
14:47 <mbryant> we are working with import, so is there a way to have the import without the gallery  
14:48 <+mflorea> yes  
14:48 <+mflorea> just a sec to test something  
15:16 <+mflorea> mbryant: the easiest way is to remove the {{gallery}} wrapping after the import. Of course, this is not automated and it's a pain if you have many ppt files to import. Another quick solution if to [re]move the uicomponents/widgets/gallery/gallery.js but you won't be able to use the gallery macro anymore.  
15:18 <+mflorea> the best option is to add a parameter to the gallery macro when importing a ppt so be able to distinguish between a user made image gallery and a presentation gallery  
15:22 <mbryant> thanks mflorea, your help has been apprecited.. how bad are the errors if i just remove the gallery.js, because in a plans, we really have no direct need for the gallery at all  
15:22 <+mflorea> mbryant: fyi the gallery macro simply wraps all the images with a class=gallery DIV. The slideshow is generated by uicomponents/widgets/gallery/gallery.js which hides all the images and displayed one at a time  
15:23 <+mflorea> if you don't use the gallery macro anywhere else then there is no side effect of removing the gallery.js file  
15:23 <mbryant> alright, thank you very much, I do apprecite your time..  
15:23 <+mflorea> you're welcome  
15:25 <@cjdelisle> vmassol: Yes it is possible to invite to a closed wiki, depending on how you close the wiki. see: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/invitation/InvitationTest.java#L510  
15:25 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok… I'm asking because on http://ossgtp.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Invitation/WebHome there's an error text saying "Invitations cannot be accepted because this wiki is closed. ..."  
15:31 <vmassol> then I says "Afin de permettre aux personnes invitées de rejoindre le wiki, veuillez sauver http://ossgtp.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Invitation/InvitationGuestActions avec un utilisateur doté des droits de programming. "  
15:32 <vmassol> but I have already saved that doc with a user having PR  
15:32 <vmassol> (no idea why it keeps saying it…)  
15:33 <@cjdelisle> Let me take a look at the code, I hope I didn't say the wrong document needed PR.  
15:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: if I want to remove past invitation messages can I delete the objects from http://ossgtp.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Invitation/InvitationMessages?editor=object ?  
15:36 <abusenius> has quit  
15:50 <@cjdelisle> Yes you can.  
15:54 <vmassol> ok thanks

16:26 <@cjdelisle> I have kind of neglected the flickering attachment test you gave me, it looks like a race condition with the attachments and I have found another attachment (deletion) issue which looks very serious.

16:26 <@cjdelisle> That is the one I have been concentrating most of my time on.

16:28 <@cjdelisle> ok, I will fill you in.  
16:28 <+mflorea> thanks

17:19 <+tmortagne> guys just made XWiki snapshot maven repository a Debian repository ;)  
17:19 <+tmortagne> doing some experiment  
17:20 <+tmortagne> the idea is that you can add  
17:20 <+tmortagne> deb http://maven.xwiki.org snapshots  
17:21 <+tmortagne> will do the same for releases one  
17:21 <+tmortagne> and with a one line cron we have everything we deploy automatically available on a debian repository  
17:22 <@sdumitriu> Speaking of cron  
17:22 <+tmortagne> of course if we don't need to have separated deb files by dists but right now we really don't  
17:22 <@sdumitriu> We should add a job that checks artifacts agains their PGP signature  
17:22 <@sdumitriu> Now that we have signatures  
17:23 <+sburjan> why did we add PGP signatures ?  
17:23 <+tmortagne> speaking of PGP it's cool we start doing it since it's needed for a clean debian repository too
